page.title: 03INDUSTRY
page.content: {GLOUCESTER TRADING ESTATE}is about 4 miles from the centre of Gloucester and provides employment for about 2000 people.The site was once used by the Gloucester Aircraft Co.which employed about 7000 people during World War Two.It eventually became the Glos.Whitworth Aircraft Co.which made RAF jet aircraft.In 1964 the factory closed leaving several aircraft hangers which now house the present companies.There is one central company called GTE Services which provides medical care,a canteen,security,and maintenance for all the tenants.There are 40 companies on the site.Some things made or sold are: navigation instruments,motor parts,electrical equipment,computer parts,plastic film,plywood,and heating apparatus. Office development is anticipated. There is easy access to the A40 and M5
